title: Guy Garvey on the transformative power of becoming a father in his 40s – just before losing his own
text:
Elbow singer Guy Garvey tells Anna Pointer about finding love and fatherhood in his 40s, just before losing his own dad

His new album bears the pain of recent bereavement and political uncertainty, but Elbow singer Guy Garvey is in an unmistakably chipper mood. “In Sainsbury’s the other day, I had this sudden rush of euphoria. I couldn’t think of a moment when I’ve felt happier.”

Sipping tea in a south London recording studio, the source of the Mancunian songwriter’s contentment is clear: life with his actor wife Rachael Stirling – daughter of Dame Diana Rigg – and their two-year-old son, Jack. “The sun was shining, we’d giggled our way around the supermarket and I was feeling like a pretty...
